title: Five Sounds, No Labels
instruction: Notice five distinct sounds. For each one, stay with the raw texture of the sound without naming its source.

title: One Object, Become New
instruction: Pick a completely ordinary object. Look at it until you notice three details you have never noticed before.

title: Contact Points Inventory
instruction: Notice every place your body touches something: chair, floor, clothing, air. Count at least six distinct contact points.

title: Edge of Vision
instruction: Keep your gaze soft and notice the edges of your visual field. Hold awareness of the centre and the periphery at the same time.

title: Three Textures
instruction: Touch three different surfaces. Notice how each texture changes as you move from fingertip to palm to the back of the hand.

title: Pre-Thought Emotion Check
instruction: For 60 seconds, notice the first emotional tone in your body before any story forms. Name nothing; just detect the direction (tightening, opening, buzzing, heaviness).

title: Single Point: A Sound
instruction: Choose one continuous sound (fan, traffic, distant voices). Keep attention with it, and each time you drift, return to the sound’s shape.

title: Micro-Delay Before Reacting
instruction: Think of a small irritation from today. Replay it briefly and insert a one-second pause right before the reaction.

title: Name-to-Sensation Swap
instruction: When a label appears (“annoyed”, “tired”, “fine”), drop the label and look for the sensation it refers to. Stay with the sensation for 10 seconds.

title: Slow Walk: Heel to Toe
instruction: Walk slowly for two minutes. Put attention on the sequence: heel contact, weight shift, toe release.

title: Two-Minute Listening (Relational)
instruction: In your next conversation, listen for two minutes with full attention. Notice the urge to respond, and let it wait until the other person finishes.

title: Face Without Story
instruction: Look at a face (photo or person) and notice shapes, shadows, and movement without constructing a narrative. Treat it like an unfamiliar landscape.

title: Narrow-to-Wide Attention
instruction: Start by focusing on one sensation for 30 seconds. Then widen to include sounds, sights, and body sensations all at once.

title: Impulse Surf (Mild)
instruction: Notice a mild impulse (check phone, snack, tab switch). Watch it rise and fall for 20 seconds without acting on it.
contra_notes: Choose only a mild impulse. If this increases distress, stop and do a sensory practice instead.

title: Room Scan: What Pulls You?
instruction: Scan the room and notice what grabs your attention first. Ask: is it brightness, motion, threat, comfort, or curiosity?

title: Body Weather Report
instruction: Notice your body like weather: pressure, temperature, movement, stillness. Identify two “fronts” (e.g., tight jaw + warm hands).

title: Unfinished Sentence
instruction: Complete this silently: “Right now, what I most want is …” Then notice what changes in your body after the sentence lands.

title: Tension Localisation
instruction: Find the strongest tension in your body. Zoom in: does it have edges, pulses, heat, or movement?

title: One Task, One Channel
instruction: For three minutes, do one simple task with full attention (wash a cup, fold clothing, tidy one surface). Notice each micro-movement.

title: The Urge to Explain
instruction: Notice when your mind starts explaining an experience. Pause the explanation and return to what is directly present for 10 seconds.

title: Mild Discomfort Hold
instruction: Choose a mild discomfort (standing still, cool air, slight awkwardness). Stay with it for 30 seconds and observe its changing shape.
contra_notes: Keep it mild. Do not use injury pain or intense distress. Stop if it escalates.

title: Attention Hand-Off
instruction: Pick two senses (sound and sight, or touch and sound). Switch attention between them every 10 seconds without rushing.

title: Tiny Gratification Delay
instruction: Pick a tiny gratification you were about to take (scroll, snack, refresh). Delay it by 30 seconds and notice what the delay reveals.
contra_notes: Keep it small. This is not a willpower challenge; stop if it becomes a struggle.

title: Three Micro-Choices
instruction: Over the next hour, notice three micro-choices you make automatically. For each, pause for one second before doing it.

title: Listen for the Quietest Sound
instruction: Search for the quietest sound you can detect. When you find it, hold attention there and notice how it changes.

title: One Minute of Direct Eye Contact
instruction: If appropriate and comfortable, hold gentle eye contact for one minute during a conversation. Notice any urge to look away and what it signals.
contra_notes: Only do this in safe, normal contexts. Skip if it feels intrusive or unsafe.

title: Speech as Sound
instruction: For 60 seconds, listen to speech as pure sound: rhythm, pitch, speed, pauses. Let meaning be secondary.

title: Hands: Temperature Gradient
instruction: Notice temperature differences across your hands: fingertips, knuckles, palm, wrist. Track where warmth begins and ends.

title: Attention as a Spotlight
instruction: Imagine attention as a spotlight you can steer. Move it deliberately: sound → hands → sight → back to sound.

title: The First Thought After Silence
instruction: Create a brief moment of silence (no inputs). Notice the very first thought that appears and what it tries to do.

title: Spot the Background Effort
instruction: Notice any subtle effort you’re carrying: bracing, holding, clenching, rushing. Let one small effort reduce by 10%.

title: Colour Temperature Hunt
instruction: Look for three different colour temperatures around you (cool, neutral, warm). Notice how each changes the feeling of a space.

title: Minute of Not Fixing
instruction: Pick a minor problem you keep mentally fixing. For one minute, let the problem exist without solving it and notice what arises.
contra_notes: Use only minor issues. Skip anything that feels urgent or high-stakes.

title: Micro-Awe Scan
instruction: Find one small detail that is unexpectedly intricate (a leaf vein, a fabric weave, a circuit pattern). Stay with it until it feels slightly vast.

title: Relational: Listen for Need
instruction: In a conversation, listen for what the other person may be needing (clarity, reassurance, space, recognition). Don’t act on it—just notice it.

title: Notice the Want Behind the Want
instruction: Pick something you want right now. Ask once: what is the deeper want beneath it (comfort, certainty, connection, status, rest)?

title: Sound Distance Layering
instruction: Identify one near sound, one mid-distance sound, and one far sound. Hold all three in awareness at the same time.

title: Neutral Face, Neutral Story
instruction: Notice a neutral expression (your own reflection works). Watch how your mind assigns meaning to it, then return to the raw shapes again.

title: Two-Minute Waiting Room
instruction: For two minutes, do nothing except notice what tries to fill the space. Track: restlessness, planning, scanning, or drifting.
contra_notes: If restlessness becomes intense, switch to a sensory practice (sounds or contact points).

title: Value Signal Spotting
instruction: Recall a moment from today that tugged at you (pleasant or unpleasant). Identify the value signal inside it: care, fairness, belonging, competence, freedom, or safety.
